summary.label:
Has it ever happened that you have to meet someone and the person can't explain where he/she is? This app will quickly find the location of another phone by sending a text message request. Most phones manufactured after 2010 can accept this request, no need to install any additional app on the 2nd person's phone. It does not get any easier than this!

How it is working:

• User A wants to know a User B location.

• User A enters the phone number of User B into the app.

• The app generates a unique URL, and the URL is sent to User B.

• If User B clicks on the link, user A will see the location of user B.

Limitations:

• This is not a spy app. User B must agree to share the location with you.

• If User B has a device without GPS (desktop computer, tablet), the determined location may have a large accuracy margin (up to 5 km).

• In rare situations, when user B is behind the corporate proxy, the app can show the proxy's location, not the user's.

The user location is determined in three ways:

• E.123, E.164
• RIR
• W3C Geolocation API

Title: Full Access 1m

For example, if you’re taking a long trip, you can plan different waypoints, tracks and routes for each day of the trip and combine them into one collection.

Your Mobile Cloud Connection

The Garmin Explore app will send and store the waypoints, planned routes, GPS tracks and Garmin activities you've recorded in the cloud, allowing you to access and use that data on the Garmin Explore web site to plan or review your adventures. You can also sync your cloud-stored data with a compatible Garmin device. A Garmin account is needed to store your data in the cloud. Your activities (e.g., runs, walks, hikes, etc.) include data such as distance, pace, activity time, location, etc. that were recorded by your device.

The Garmin Explore app allows you to access your phone’s contact list for easier messaging and sharing when connected.

Do you just want to watch which planes are currently flying above your house or do you want to know where the flight from your friends, family or business contacts is now? Do this easily with this flight status tracker. This app allows locating and tracking flights – whether domestic or international, short or long – all this is live and free.

Using this flight radar is very simple. Search for a flight by entering the flight number or by using the flight tracking map and selecting the plane. You will then be shown various details about this plane and its current route.

Available plane details:
-aircraft type and photos
-airline and flight number
-flight origin and destination airports
-departure and arrival time
-altitude, speed and heading
-signal source and accuracy

This live flight radar app also contains an airport map. With this map you can find out the most important information about large and small airports from all over the world with just one click.

A compass is also integrated into this tracking app. This easy-to-use compass helps you to determine your own current position and thus helps you spotting planes with the flight radar map around your current location.

Flight tracking is exciting for several reasons. As an aviation fan, you can track flights just with one free flight radar app from your smartphone or tablet. You get more information about the current flight status than at the airport. If your friends or family are on a plane, you can easily track their flight online in real time. The practical thing is that this easy flight tracker app helps you get to the airport in time should a flight landed earlier or be delayed.

Are you wondering how it is possible that all this information appears live on your smartphone or tablet? Most modern aircraft have an ADS-B (Automatic Dependent Surveillance Broadcast) transponder installed. This transponder then transmits the air traffic information to a network of ground stations around the world, so that you can see the exact current flight position and details about the aircraft.

In the whole world, Synthetic Vision displaying in the EFIS-like view the ups and downs of rolling terrain ahead is available.

Airmate includes a worldwide aeronautical database updated free of charge with airports, navigation beacons, waypoints, airways, obstacles, regulated and restricted areas. Topographic maps and elevation data for most countries may be downloaded free of charge, as well as additional aviation map overlays such US Sectionals. A procedure database provide details of departure (SID), arrival (STAR) and instrument approaches in the USA, and you could add those procedures to your planned flight route (the procedure database includes all US airports, we are workding to add airports in other countries). Once loaded, the procedure path is displayed on the aeronautical map, including curved paths and racetracks.

When coupled with a supported external ADS-B received, Airmate will display nearby traffic on the moving map, and receive FIS-B weather and NOTAM during the flight. Airmate is able to transmit the flight plan data to supported avionics such Dynon SkyView.

Airmate will also record your flights and allow to replay them later or export the flight path in gpx format, you could take pictures from the app during flights. Pilot log entries are automatically computed from flown flights.

summary.label:
Displays:
1. Latitude and longitude in following formats:
- DMS  degrees, minutes and seconds sexgesimal 
- DDM  degrees and decimal minutes
- DD  decimal degrees
- UTM  Universal Transverse Mercator
2. Altitude according to your device's satellite GPS receiver 
3. Approximate distance to surface. 

Other features:
- Compatibility with latest Material Design guidelines.
- Ability to share your location and information by taking a picture.
- Ability to choose what information you want to place on the picture.
- Customize photos by changing text color, text font and text position
- Save your photos in history
- Save your location data and browse through it anywhere.
- Click and send text message with your current coordinates. 
- Export or import your data from other device, even from other system.
- Export your data to popular GPX and KML formats.
- Simple tutorial that will help you use the app.
- Use a text message or share on social media or by email, your location information “what is my altitude?” to your friends.
- Copy coordinates to your clipboard.
- Customize how long the application should maintain its location after closing it.

Simple explanation of displays: 
1. Latitude and longitude in decimal format according to your GPS receiver.
2. Altitude according to your GPS receiver adjusted for sea level. (
Accuracy is up to +-10m)
3. Approximate distance to surface
4. Seconds since last GPS satellite signal
5. Accuracy of GPS satellite signal

Requires a satellite GPS receiver to function properly. WiFi assisted GPS does not report altitude.

Disclaimer 
- GPS does not work well indoors.
- GPS accuracy depends on the receiver in your device.
- Data connection is required to get elevation data.

Units include:
- Meters
- Feet
- Yards
